prompts:
Alright Claude, so what we're going to be doing here in this session is we're going to be doing some road mapping and this is going to lead to a master specification of everything that I'm going to need to launch the paid version of Thoughtbox via the Google Cloud Platform deployment. \
\
I'll describe what I know we need so far. First of all, we're going to need a web app, and we'll need to decide where we're hosting it. I would assume that Google Cloud Platform is the natural choice, but I'm not much of a web developer, so let me know what the pros and cons are there. In this web app, we're going to need a page where where users can sign up for Thoughtbox --> once users have an account and log in, they should have a dashboard landing page. this landing page should have a navbar that populates different dialogs without leaving the page location. these dialogs should be for:

1. Playground --> this will be a modern chatbot interface where users can experiment with Thoughtbox
2. Traces --> users will be able to view reasoning chains from previous sessions, or an active one
3. Billing --> users will be able to enter their billing information \
4. (later) Configuration --> users will be able to make changes to how Thoughtbox is configured for their user
\
My guess is that Next.js makes the most sense to use a framework here, which is why I wonder if Vercel is the better deployment option. We'd also be able to make natural use of the Vercel AI SDK in that context, which is important for the chatbot. I think that AI SDK 6 has full native support for MCP as well. \
\
For the payments layer, I think we should use Stripe. We're going to charge $0.01 per call to Thoughtbox. I'll need to set up a Stripe account, but that's separate from what we're concerned with here, which is the full architectural picture of everything we need to launch. \
\
Ask me any questions that you need to ask to get the full picture and we'll iterate from there. Additionally, start producing the master specification document (markdown) in a new master-spec/ folder at the project's root, which we'll gitignore/dockerignore/etc. --> use the description above and document those pieces + review the codebase and existing specs to help you document what we've already got

$0.01/call is the intended pricing: good catch. \
\
1. Users should be able to sign up with both email/password and Google Auth | let's do paid-only from day one | when a user hits $0 balance, we can allow a small grace period similar to OpenRouter \
\
2. I'll supply the LLM --> I'll find a free-tier model on OpenRouter. Users should be able to bring their own API key. For simplicity, let's only support Anthropic for BYOK at launch.
\
3. Per-pay credits for sure | Minimum credit purchase should be $5 | we'll implement auto-refill at some point, but let's push that off til post-launch \
\
4. Let's do Vercel for the frontend and GCP Cloud Run for the MCP server

1. I'll actually throw this one back to you: what do you see the pros and cons to each option as? \
2. Let's do moonshotai/kimi-k2:free \
3. Reset grace to $0 \
4. There aren't any beta testers yet: I'll want to grant free credits to a good number of these.
